snippet: Cargill sold 10 properties in Japan last week for $20 million, but a partner said the deal was improper because its management contract had two more years to go.
abstract: Cargill subsidiary sells 10 so-called love hotel properties in Japan for $20 million to developer Kato Pleasure Group, but partner Alchemy says the deal is improper because its management contract was not up until Oct 2014; Alchemy also contends Kato Pleasure has ties to Japan's criminal underground.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and STEPHANIE STROM
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Kawagoe, Japan, and Stephanie Strom from New York. Ken Belson contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Cargill sold 10 properties in Japan last week for $20 million, but a partner said the deal was improper because its management contract had two more years to go.

headline.seo: Conflict in Cargill Sale of ‘Love Hotel’ in Japan
